news_header: Serious problems found in homes insulated under government schemes; 39 businesses suspended for poor quality work.
news_text: An audit revealed widespread issues with external wall insulation installations under UK government schemes, leading to the suspension of 39 businesses. The Minister for Energy Consumers, Miatta Fahnbulleh, stated that many installations did not meet required standards, resulting in potential health risks and significant repair costs for affected households. The government aims to address these issues swiftly, while calls for a review of other insulation schemes continue.
